intro: Allosorus pulchellus, commonly known as the showy rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to alpine environments. Allosorus pulchellus is often found in open meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
